page.title: 04Birds
page.content: {BUZZARD. } They are found all over the world except in Australasia.Only the common buzzard lives and nests in Great Britain. It is a handsome bird, dark brown above and usually barred brown and white below.{The Tawny {Owl}is about 38 centimetres long and the largest of the British owl. It is found in wood and gardens and sometimes in towns, but rarely in open country. {KESTREL.} The Kestrel is well known for its habit of hovering which it does by facing the wind and rapidly flapping its wings. In this way it does not move forward over the ground but instead stays above one spot watching for its prey. These birds of prey are all resident in this area, as are the{Barn Owl, {Little Owl and Sparrow Hawk.}Many Waterfowl are also to be found, including{Grebe,Swans,Mallard,&Teal.
